data.title: TSLA Stock Price Increases 13.19% After Hours: Why It Happened
data.text: The stock price of Tesla Inc (NASDAQ: TSLA) increased by 13.19% from $408.09 to $461.92 after hours. This is why it happened.

data.title: Tesla set to join the S&P 500 Index in December
data.text: Tesla will join the S&P 500 Index, effective December 21, according to a Monday announcement from S&P Global.

data.title: Tesla is added to the S&P 500
data.text: The news that investors were waiting for finally came after the closing bell on Monday as Tesla (NASDAQ:TSLA) was finally announced that it would be added to the S&P 500 index as of December 21, 2020.

data.title: Tesla joining S&P 500 group of companies
data.text: Electric vehicle maker Tesla Inc. (NASDAQ : TSLA) will become part of the S&P 500, the latest milestone for the 17-year-old company as it continues to grow. “Tesla will be added to the S&P 500 effective prior to the open of trading Dec. 21 to coincide with the December quarterly rebalance,” S&P Dow Jones Indices said in a statement.

data.title: Tesla gets a spot on the S&P 500
data.text: Tesla will be added to the S&P 500, a milestone that will expand its investor base and put the electric automaker in the same company as heavyweights like Apple, Berkshire Hathaway and Microsoft. The announcement, made Monday afternoon by the S&P Dow Jones Indices, sent shares 13.7% higher in after-market trading.

data.title: Tesla Set To Join S&P 500 Next Month–And Shares Are Soaring
data.text: The electric-vehicle maker was notably passed up by the index giant in September.

data.title: Tesla stock jumps 8 percent as automaker is added to S&P 500
data.text: Four months after achieving it's first full year of profitability, Tesla has been accepted into the benchmark S&P 500 index. The electric automaker will be included as a member of the popular stock index on Dec. 21, S&P Global announced in a surprise announcement Monday — sending shares of Tesla up nearly 8 percent in.

data.title: Tesla Stock Jumps on News It Will Join the S&P 500
data.text: Investors have been anticipating its inclusion for months.

data.title: Tesla will join the S&P 500 in December after being snubbed earlier this year
data.text: Tesla will be added to the S&P 500 later this year, S&P Dow Jones Indices announced Monday.  Tesla will join the exclusive club of companies prior to the open of trading on Monday, December 21. Shares of the electric-vehicle manufacturer jumped more than 13% on the news in after-hours trading.

data.title: Elon Musk's Tesla joining S&P 500
data.text: Elon Musk's Tesla just received a big badge of honor.

data.title: Tesla stock jumps after news company will join S&P 500
data.text: Tesla Inc. stock rallied more than 10% in after-hours Monday after S&P Dow Jones Indices said it will add the electric-car maker to the S&P 500 at the start of trading on Dec. 21.

data.title: Tesla jumps 9%, company to join S&P 500
data.text: Shares of Tesla surged 9% in extended trade on Monday after S&P Dow Jones Indices announced that the electric car maker would join the S&P 500 index.

data.title: Tesla Will (Finally) Be Added To The S&P 500
data.text: Tesla Inc (NASDAQ: TSLA) will be added to the S&P after months and months of speculation. The move will take effect prior to the open of trading on Dec. 21, 2020, to coincide with the December quarterly rebalance.

data.title: Tesla stock jumps on news company is joining S&P 500
data.text: Tesla will join the S&P 500 effective prior to trading on Monday, Dec. 21.

data.title: U.S. upgrades safety probe into nearly 159,000 Tesla vehicles
data.text: The U.S. National Highway Traffic Safety Administration (NHTSA) said on Monday it was upgrading a probe into nearly 159,000 Tesla Model S and Model X vehicles over touchscreen failures to an engineering analysis.

data.title: Tesla Will No Longer Offer $35,000 Model 3
data.text: When the Model 3 was first revealed, Tesla Inc (NASDAQ: TSLA) promoted a more affordable electric car, announcing a base version for $35,000. While it wasn't available initially at launch, the company did offer the low cost "Standard Range" Model 3, although most of its life was spent off menu as an off menu special request.

data.title: Fed probe of Tesla camera failures could lead to recall
data.text: US safety regulators are continuing their investigation into complaints that Tesla's giant touch screens can fail and cause the cars to lose the rear camera display and other functions. The National Highway Traffic Safety Administration's report says about 159,000 cars could be affected by the problem.

data.title: 7 Hot Stocks for Post-Election Investing in Biden's America
data.text: This election has swung the pendulum for hot stocks. If you want to adjust your portfolio for the next four years, look no further than these seven picks.

data.title: Tesla Gigafactory Texas Construction Underway 24/7
data.text: After Gigafactory Shanghai completed construction, with the first vehicles delivered in less than one year, many were hopeful Tesla Inc (NASDAQ: TSLA) could show the same speed at Gigafactory Berlin and Texas. Just days ago, new aerial photos and video showed the site's progress.

data.title: Tesla Model X Still Ahead Of BMW iX, Despite Years Of Research
data.text: BMW's new iX all-electric SUV goes on sale in 2022, 7 years after Tesla's Model X, and it will still be two to three years behind the U.S. company's current crucial battery and connectivity technology. Germany's Center of Automotive Management says Mercedes and Audi will also lag behind Tesla.

data.title: Tesla Opens The World's Largest Supercharger Station
data.text: Tesla Inc (NASDAQ: TSLA) has opened the world's largest Supercharger station with 56 stalls in Firebaugh, California, Electrek reported Saturday. What Happened: While the Elon Musk-led company has Supercharger stations with 50 stalls in China, 56 is a new record for the automaker, according to Electrek.

data.title: Tesla, Nio, Nikola, Zoom — Stocks The Largest US Pension Fund Is Betting On
data.text: California Public Employees Retirement System (CalPERS), the largest public pension fund in the United States by assets, has increased its exposure to stocks of Nio Inc (NYSE: NIO), Nikola Corporation (NASDAQ: NKLA), and Zoom Video Communications Inc (NASDAQ: ZM), the fund disclosed in a form filed with the U.S. Securities and Exchange Commission. What Happened: CalPERS increased its investments in Nikola and Nio and almost doubled its stake in Zoom.
